CategoricalVariation.description: A representation of a categorically-defined  [functional domain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_of_a_function)  for variation, in which individual variation instances may be members.

ComplexVariation.description: A categorical variation domain jointly characterized by two or more other categorical  variation domains.

_id.description: Categorical Variation Id. MUST be unique within document.

complement.description: This field indicates that a categorical variation is defined to include (false) or exclude (true) variation concepts matching the categorical variation. This is  equivalent to a logical NOT operation on the categorical variation properties.

operands.description: The CategoricalVariation objects that are being evaluated collectively.

operator.description: The logical operation applied to evaluating the object *operands*. MUST be "AND" or "OR".

CanonicalVariation.description: A categorical variation domain characterized by a representative Variation context  to which members lift-over, project, translate, or otherwise directly align.

_id.description: Categorical Variation Id. MUST be unique within document.

complement.description: This field indicates that a categorical variation is defined to include (false) or exclude (true) variation concepts matching the categorical variation. This is  equivalent to a logical NOT operation on the categorical variation properties.

variation.description: The [VRS Variation](https://vrs.ga4gh.org/en/1.2.1/terms_and_model.html#variation) object to which congruency must be determined.
